@source-hash: 6fd2ccd30057bfb1
@generated: 2026-02-09T17:57:44Z

## Python 2/3 Compatibility Library (six)

This is a vendored copy of the `six` library providing utilities for writing code that runs on both Python 2 and 3. The library abstracts away version differences through compatibility shims, type aliases, and moved module mappings.

### Core Version Detection & Type Aliases (L35-77)
- `PY2`, `PY3`, `PY34` (L36-38): Boolean flags for version detection
- Type aliases adapt to Python version:
  - `string_types`, `integer_types`, `class_types` (L41-51): Tuples of compatible types
  - `text_type`, `binary_type` (L44-53): String type abstractions
  - `MAXSIZE` (L47-72): Platform-appropriate maximum size constant

### Lazy Loading Infrastructure (L80-238)
- `_LazyDescr` (L91-105): Base descriptor for lazy attribute resolution
- `MovedModule` (L107-125): Handles modules moved between Python versions
- `MovedAttribute` (L141-163): Handles attributes/functions moved between versions
- `_SixMetaPathImporter` (L165-238): PEP302 meta path importer for `six.moves` namespace

### Moves Namespace (L240-542)
- `_MovedItems` (L243-349): Lazy module containing all moved objects
- `moves` (L348): Main interface providing Python 3-style imports
- Extensive mappings (L250-333) for stdlib modules moved/renamed between versions
- Specialized urllib submodules (L352-541) with their own lazy loading classes

### Function/Method Compatibility (L560-635)
- Method attribute name mappings (L561-576): `__func__` vs `im_func`, etc.
- `advance_iterator`/`next` (L578-587): Iterator protocol compatibility
- `callable` (L589-595): Restored for Python versions lacking it
- Method creation utilities (L597-635): Bound/unbound method handling

### Dictionary Iteration (L637-682)
- `iterkeys`, `itervalues`, `iteritems` (L639-675): Iterator variants for both versions
- `viewkeys`, `viewvalues`, `viewitems` (L651-674): Dictionary view objects

### String/Bytes Handling (L684-743)
- `b()`, `u()` (L686-722): Byte/unicode literal functions
- `unichr`, byte conversion utilities (L692-733)
- `StringIO`/`BytesIO` compatibility (L702-736)

### Unit Test Compatibility (L745-759)
Assert method name mappings for unittest differences between versions.

### Execution & Exception Handling (L761-812)
- `exec_()` (L762-787): Cross-version code execution
- `reraise()` (L764-796): Exception re-raising with traceback
- `raise_from()` (L799-812): Exception chaining support

### Print Function (L814-884)
Complete backport of Python 3's print function for Python 2 compatibility.

### Advanced Features (L888-1050)
- `wraps()` (L894-927): functools.wraps compatibility for older Python versions
- `with_metaclass()` (L929-951): Metaclass creation utility
- `add_metaclass()` (L953-971): Class decorator for metaclass application
- String coercion utilities (L973-1031): `ensure_binary`, `ensure_str`, `ensure_text`
- `python_2_unicode_compatible()` (L1033-1050): Decorator for Unicode string handling

### Module Initialization (L1052-1076)
Configures this module as a package and installs the meta path importer for the moves functionality.

**Key Dependencies:** functools, itertools, operator, sys, types, importlib.util (Python 3.4+)

**Architecture:** Uses lazy loading descriptors and a custom meta path importer to provide seamless Python 2/3 compatibility without performance penalties for unused features.
